title: Alexey V. Kravtsov
text:
Alexei V. Kravtzov (1879 – December 30, 1918) was a <a href="colonel">colonel</a> of the <a href="Imperial%20Russian%20Army">Imperial Russian Army</a> and <a href="Don%20Republic">Don Republic</a> officer, killed in the Battle of Loznoye during the <a href="Russian%20Civil%20War">Russian Civil War</a>. He was a military commander and organizer of the <a href="1st%20Cossack%20Volunteer%20Cavalry%20Regiment">1st Cossack Volunteer Cavalry Regiment</a> at the <a href="stanitsa">stanitsa</a> <a href="Serafimovich%20%28town%29">Ust-Medveditskaya</a>.
Alexei was born in <a href="Novocherkassk">Novocherkassk</a>, <a href="Don%20Host%20Oblast">Don Host Oblast</a>, to <a href="Yesaul">Yesaul</a> Vladimir A. Kravtzov, hero of the <a href="Russo-Japanese%20War">Russo-Japanese War</a> of the a <a href="Don%20Cossacks">Don Cossacks</a> <a href="Don%20Cossacks%20noble%20families">family</a> of <a href="Kravtzov%20family">Kravtzov</a>. Kravtzov graduated from Novocherkassk Military School for the 1st Class. <a href="Yesaul">Yesaul</a> on September 5, 1914. At the start of <a href="World%20War%20I">World War I</a> Alexei Kravtzov was put in charge of the 57th Don Cossacks Regiment. During the opening stages of <a href="Russian%20Civil%20War">Russian Civil War</a> Kravtzov served in the <a href="Don%20Army">Don Army</a>. He organized <a href="1st%20Cossack%20Volunteer%20Cavalry%20Regiment">1st Cossack Volunteer Cavalry Regiment</a> in March 1918 at the <a href="stanitsa">stanitsa</a> <a href="Serafimovich%20%28town%29">Ust-Medveditskaya</a>, and was commissioned as a <a href="colonel">colonel</a> in the <a href="Don%20Army">Don Army</a>. His Regiment took heavy losses during the <a href="Ice%20March">Ice March</a>. He shot himself not to fall into the Bolshevik hands wounded during the Battle of Loznoye from December 22 to December 30, 1918, where his regiment save by manoeuvre corps of <a href="Don%20Army">Don Army</a> under command of General <a href="Alexnder%20V.%20Golubintzev">Alexnder V. Golubintzev</a>.
